option.value: Changing Passive Voice to Active Voice - Turning Passive to Active

slidelink.displaytext: Grammar Lesson - Active and Passive Tone
Changing Passive Voice to Active Voice
Changing Sentences from Passive to Active Voice
Identifying the Voice of a Sentence using the SUBJECT

search.slidetext: changing passive voice to active voice next improving your writing skills one part-of-speech at a time!

lesson overview learning objectives identifying subjects and verbs in a sentence. determining the difference between passive and active voice. creating sentences with active voice. changing sentences from passive voice to active voice. start
changing sentences from passive voice to active voice objective 4

let’s see this in action! a sentence written in the passive voice will usually have the subject at the end of the sentence. remember:you can identify the subject of a sentence by looking for the verb, or action, of the sentence. whatever performs the verb is the subject. how can you tell a sentence is written in passive voice or active voice? changing sentences from passive voice to active voice

sentence 2 correct! the subject is placed at the back of the sentence. this tells us that the sentence is in the passive voice. sentence 1 incorrect. look at where the subject is in the sentence. the piano was played by taylor. vs. taylor played the piano. how can you tell a sentence is written in passive voice or active voice? changing sentences from passive voice to active voice which sentence is in the passive voice? click on the circled number of the sentence you think is in the passive voice.
let’s review what we’ve learned! how can you tell a sentence is written in passive voice or active voice? changing sentences from passive voice to active voice

taylor played the piano. now you have an active sentence! the subject is looking good in the spotlight! taylor played by the piano. next, delete any extra words—like the preposition by—to make sure your sentence makes sense. to test if your sentence makes sense read it out loud! taylor was played by the piano. next, delete any versions of “to be” from the sentence. sometimes, you’ll need to change the tense of the main verb of the sentence, but in this case, we do not have to change it. taylor was played by the piano . then move the object to the back of the sentence. make sure to check your grammar as you change things around so that everything is properly capitalized. taylor the piano was played by . to change a passive voice sentence into the active voice, start with moving the subject to the front of the sentence. the subject in an active sentence should be the focus! the piano was played by taylor. now we see that since the subject of the sentence is placed at the end, it is written in the passive voice. changing the sentence into the active voice is simple! the piano was played by taylor. the object being played is the piano. there is a preposition, by, in the sentence, but we don’t need it to see that the subject, taylor, is at the end of the sentence. the piano was played by taylor. the thing in the sentence doing the playing will be the subject. taylor is doing the action, was played, which makes it the subject. the piano was played by taylor. the action, or verb, of the sentence is the phrase, “was played.” another indicator of passive voice is the use of the verb ”to be” somewhere in the sentence, was, before the main verb, played. move the slider below with your arrow keys or by clicking and dragging to review how to identify passive voice and change it to the active voice! the piano was played by taylor. how can you tell a sentence is written in passive voice or active voice and change it to be active? changing sentences from passive voice to active voice

fun tip on using passive! passive voice can be strong depending on the context of the sentence. it can highlight other important parts of a sentence that may not be the subject. for example, if taylor had not played a piano in years, putting focus on the piano in a passive sentence can reinforce that context! the piano was played by taylor. active voice is a good way of getting a clear, direct idea across. changing a sentence from being in passive voice to active involves making sure the subject is at the front of the sentence. read your sentence aloud to make sure it makes grammatical sense after changing it. summary changing sentences from passive voice to active voice
time to practice changing sentences from passive voice to active voice let’s go!

type “i am ready!” when you’re ready to help me fix my speech. [type “i am ready!” in the textbox below.] whenever you’re ready to submit an answer you’ve typed in the text box, hit “enter” on your keyboard, or click the checkmark at the bottom-right. change what’s in the thought bubble into something that sounds stronger! something that’s less passive. [click to proceed] [click to proceed] [click to proceed] [click to proceed] [click to proceed] [click to proceed] a preview of what was originally written in my speech will appear here in a thought bubble! [click to proceed] [click to proceed] [click to proceed] [click to proceed] [click to proceed] [click to proceed] it’s my first time speaking to a crowd and i want to get my ideas across as clearly as possible! [click to proceed] [click to proceed] [click to proceed] [click to proceed] [click to proceed] [click to proceed] incorrect make sure you’ve read through the speech bubbles to see the answer. try again try again try again try again try again try again incorrect make sure you’ve read through the speech bubbles to see the answer. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct let’s get started! continue continue continue continue continue continue type your text here help thomas give a strong speech! hi there! i’ve hired you to help me give a strong speech! hi there! i’ve hired you to help me give a strong speech! [click to proceed] [click to proceed] [click to proceed] [click to proceed] [click to proceed] [click to proceed]

incorrect that sentence could be stronger. check that you’ve identified the subject. and that it’s at the front of the sentence. try again try again try again try again try again try again incorrect that sentence could be stronger. check that you’ve identified the subject. and that it’s at the front of the sentence. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that's right! that’s a strong sentence! continue continue continue continue continue continue a good future is dreamed of by the world. vote thomas for council chair!

incorrect that sentence could be stronger. check that you’ve identified the subject. and that it’s at the front of the sentence. you’ll need to change “me” to another pronoun. try again try again try again try again try again try again incorrect that sentence could be stronger. check that you’ve identified the subject. and that it’s at the front of the sentence. you’ll need to change “me” to another pronoun. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that's right! that’s a strong sentence! continue continue continue continue continue continue that dream will be made to come true because of me. vote thomas for council chair!

incorrect that sentence could be stronger. check that you’ve identified the subject. and that it’s at the front of the sentence. you’ll need to change “me” to another pronoun. try again try again try again try again try again try again incorrect that sentence could be stronger. check that you’ve identified the subject. and that it’s at the front of the sentence. you’ll need to change “me” to another pronoun. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that's right! that’s a strong sentence! continue continue continue continue continue continue you voices are heard by me. vote thomas for council chair!

incorrect that sentence could be stronger. check that you’ve identified the subject. and that it’s at the front of the sentence. you’ll need to change “me” to another pronoun. try again try again try again try again try again try again incorrect that sentence could be stronger. check that you’ve identified the subject. and that it’s at the front of the sentence. you’ll need to change “me” to another pronoun. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that's right! that’s a strong sentence! continue continue continue continue continue continue your rights are fought for by me! vote thomas for council chair!

incorrect that sentence could be stronger. check that you’ve identified the subject. and that it’s at the front of the sentence. you’ll need to change “me” to another pronoun. try again try again try again try again try again try again incorrect that sentence could be stronger. check that you’ve identified the subject. and that it’s at the front of the sentence. you’ll need to change “me” to another pronoun. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that's right! that’s a strong sentence! continue continue continue continue continue continue i am trusted by the people. vote thomas for council chair!
let’s see if thomas gave a good speech!

terms.term: Active voice clearly lets you know WHAT is performing the action of the sentence by placing the SUBJECT at the front of the sentence.
Something in the sentence that is being acted on by the subject.
Passive voice is a sentence arranged to make the SUBJECT receive action, rather than the OBJECT.
The person, place, or thing performing the action.
The action being done in the sentence, usually by the subject.
